questions.question: Sulla's Early Career - Multiple Choice Quiz
What was the primary reason for Sulla's success in the consular elections for 88?
options: His victory in the Social War

questions.question: Which province was Sulla granted as his proconsular command, and who would he be fighting?
Who was the Tribune that allied with Marius?
What was Marius' motivation for seeking this alliance?
options: To gain power over the Senate
He wanted the command in Asia against Mithridates

questions.question: What was the Tribune's motivation in seeking his alliance with Marius?
options: He wanted to register new allies across all 35 voting tribes
To get his personal debts forgiven

questions.question: What happened after Sulla and his co-consul tried to block the Tribune's proposal?
options: Violence broke out, and Sulla fled to his army

questions.question: What unprecedented step did Sulla take after these events?
options: He marched on Rome with his army

questions.question: Once Marius and the Tribune had fled what actions did Sulla take?
options: He declared a state of emergency
He repealed the legislation passed by Sulpicius, strengthened the senate, and oversaw consular elections.

questions.question: How did Sulla strengthen the position of the senate?
options: Proposals could not be brought to the people without senatorial approval.
He limited the power of the consuls
He expanded the number of senators

questions.question: Who were elected as consuls for 87?
Once Sulla left what happened between the two consuls that led to one fleeing?
options: Cinna tried to enroll allies in the 35 tribes, Octavius blocked him and drove him out of Rome.

questions.question: Who did the fleeing consul join with before marching on Rome?
Once these two marched on Rome what did they do?
options: Repealed Marius' outlawing, reinstated Cinna as consul, and sought revenge.

questions.question: Who were chosen as consuls for 86?
Which of the consuls then died and which was re-elected as consul for 85?
options: Marius was deposed, Cinna was re-elected

questions.question: Who was the other consul elected for 85?
In what year did Sulla take Athens?
In which two battles was Mithridates defeated by Sulla in 86?
What happened to an army sent by the consul of 85 with orders to turn on Sulla?
In what year did Sulla and Mithridates reach an agreement to end the conflict?
What terms were imposed on Mithridates?
options: Evacuate Aegean territory, Join Rome as a province
Evacuate conquered territory, Remain King of Pontus
Pay tribute to Rome, Remain King of Pontus
Evacuate conquered territory, Surrender his Aegean fleet, Pay 2000 talents, Remain as King of Pontus, but as ally of Rome

questions.question: What happened to the cities who supported Mithridates?
Why had Sulla rushed this settlement?
options: He wanted to gain more territory
He was anxious to return to Rome
